STYLE.NAME: Mild
STYLE.NOTES: Low alcohol beer for the masses, not as heavy as porter. Mild refers to the lack of bitter flavor. Geneally a low gravity beer served from the cask. May include caramel, grainy, toasty or nutty flavors.
STYLE.PROFILE: Soft body, light but malty low gravity beer. Low bitterness perception, low to no hop aroma. Copper to dark brown or mahogany color. Low esters.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: English Pale or Amber malt. Crystal, Chocolate and Dextrine malts. English hops such as Goldings, Fuggles and Northdown. Characterful English ale yeast. Moderately hard water.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Fuller's Hock, Bank's Mild, Moorhouse Black Cat, Highgate Mild, Gale's Festival Mild, Goose Idland PMD Mild
